newsitem.title: UK: LCE coffee ends down as weakness continues into PM.
newsitem.headline: LCE coffee ends down as weakness continues into PM.

text.p: Robusta coffee futures closed around intraday lows at the end of Friday's session as earlier weakness predominated after selling in New York, traders said.
Activity on the London market was described as lacklustre by market players, anxious to square positions before the extended weekend. The LCE is closed on Monday due to a public holiday.
Origin sales brought the November contract back down from its earlier $1,719 high, countering the effects of fund buying.
At the close November stood $28 lower on the day at $1,667 and all other traded positions were lower. Switch activity was concentrated in Sept/Nov and overall volume totalled 4,636 lots.

Nearby tightness in New York, where the September contract received no delivery notices on Thursday against a background of insufficient certified stocks, is seen stirring the market higher in the coming days.
Technical analysts said November's rally above $1,700 was likely to extend with help from underlying support, but a heavy band of supply could keep the momentum slow.

"Critical resistance over $1,700 has now seen a more serious challenge and there is an increasing possibility it will be cleared," said Elli Gifford in the latest weekly futures summary from Investment Research in Cambridge.
"However, the market is somewhat overbought and thus a very firm close through this resistance is required if the uptrend is to accelerate enough to make $1,800 as a target realistic."
The November contract was expected to trade sideways in the medium term, but move higher on a short-term basis.
Resistance was pegged in a band between $1,700 and $1,800, with nearby support at $1,590.
